oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Giers' Art Gallery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: German born photographer Carl C. Giers (1828-1877) opened a daguerreotype studio in Nashville, Tennessee in 1855 at the corner of Deaderick Street and College Street. In 1859, Giers began offering other photographic services and changed the name of his studio to the Southern Photographic Temple of Fine Arts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Nashville (Tenn.); Photography--Studios and dark rooms; Daguerreotypists;
Galleries & museums; Photographic studios
